title: Everest Base Camp Trek
description: The ultimate trekking adventure to the base of the world's highest peak.
detailedDescription: Embark on the ultimate Himalayan adventure to Everest Base Camp. This iconic trek takes you through diverse landscapes, from lush rhododendron forests to high-altitude glacial valleys. Experience the warm hospitality of Sherpa communities, visit ancient monasteries, and witness breathtaking mountain vistas including Everest, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam.
accommodation: Tea houses and lodges with basic amenities
meals: All meals included during trek (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
physicalFitness: Good physical fitness required. Ability to walk 5-7 hours daily on mountain terrain. Previous trekking experience recommended.
culturalExperience: Immerse yourself in Sherpa culture, visit ancient Buddhist monasteries, participate in local festivals if timing permits, and learn about traditional mountain life.
itinerary: Fly to Lukla (2,840m) and trek to Phakding (2,610m) - 3-4 hours
Trek to Namche Bazaar (3,440m) - 5-6 hours through Sagarmatha National Park
Acclimatization day in Namche - explore local markets and museums
Trek to Tengboche (3,867m) - visit famous monastery with Everest views
Continue to Dingboche (4,410m) - enter high alpine zone
Acclimatization day in Dingboche - optional hike to Nagarjun Hill
Trek to Lobuche (4,910m) - memorial site for climbers
Everest Base Camp (5,364m) and return to Gorak Shep (5,164m)
Climb Kala Patthar (5,545m) for sunrise views, descend to Pheriche
Begin descent to Namche Bazaar via Tengboche
Departure or extend your stay in Nepal
included: All meals during trek (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
Accommodation in tea houses and lodges
First aid kit and emergency evacuation insurance
safetyMeasures: Experienced guides with first aid training

title: Annapurna Circuit Trek
description: A diverse trek through rhododendron forests to high alpine passes.
detailedDescription: The Annapurna Circuit is one of Nepal's most diverse and rewarding treks, offering an incredible variety of landscapes, cultures, and experiences. Cross the challenging Thorong La Pass at 5,416m, visit the sacred Muktinath Temple, and enjoy stunning sunrise views from Poon Hill.

title: Gokyo Lakes Trek
description: Discover the pristine turquoise lakes and climb Gokyo Ri for spectacular mountain views.
detailedDescription: The Gokyo Lakes Trek offers a spectacular alternative to the traditional Everest Base Camp route. This journey takes you to the pristine turquoise lakes of Gokyo, situated at over 4,700m altitude.

title: Manaslu Circuit Trek
description: Off-the-beaten-path adventure around the eighth highest mountain in the world.
detailedDescription: The Manaslu Circuit Trek is a hidden gem that offers an authentic Himalayan experience away from the crowds. This challenging trek circumnavigates Mount Manaslu (8,163m), the eighth highest peak in the world.

title: Langtang Valley Trek
description: Discover the valley of glaciers with stunning mountain views and Tamang culture.
detailedDescription: The Langtang Valley Trek, known as the "Valley of Glaciers," offers spectacular mountain scenery and rich cultural experiences through traditional Tamang villages.

title: Upper Mustang Trek
description: Journey to the forbidden kingdom with ancient Tibetan culture and landscapes.
detailedDescription: Upper Mustang, the "Last Forbidden Kingdom," offers a unique journey into ancient Tibetan culture and dramatic desert landscapes.

title: Annapurna Base Camp Trek
description: Trek to the sanctuary of the Annapurna massif with 360-degree mountain views.
detailedDescription: The Annapurna Base Camp Trek takes you into the heart of the Annapurna Sanctuary, surrounded by towering peaks over 7,000m.

title: Everest Three Passes Trek
description: The ultimate Everest region challenge crossing three high-altitude passes.
detailedDescription: The Everest Three Passes Trek is the ultimate challenge in the Everest region, crossing three high-altitude passes and including Everest Base Camp and Gokyo Lakes.

title: Ganja La Pass Trek
description: Cross the challenging Ganja La Pass connecting Langtang Valley to Helambu region.
detailedDescription: The Ganja La Pass Trek is an adventurous journey that combines the beautiful Langtang Valley with the sacred Gosaikunda Lake region. Standing at 5,106m, Ganja La Pass offers magnificent views of Langtang Lirung, Yala Peak, Ganchempo Himal, and Manaslu ranges.
meals: All meals included during trek (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
physicalFitness: Excellent physical fitness required. Previous high-altitude trekking experience essential.
culturalExperience: Experience Sherpa and Tibetan culture, visit ancient monasteries, and witness traditional mountain lifestyle.
itinerary: Arrival at Kathmandu and transfer to hotel
Kathmandu sightseeing - UNESCO World Heritage Sites
Trek to New Langtang Valley (3,500m) - 5-6 hours
Acclimatization day and explore Kyanjin Gompa
Cross Ganja La Pass (5,106m) and trek to Keldang (4,270m)
Drive back to Kathmandu via Melamchi Pul Bazaar
included: All meals during trek (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
Accommodation in tea houses and camping

title: Poon Hill Trek
description: Short and spectacular trek to one of Nepal's most famous viewpoints for sunrise over the Himalayas.
detailedDescription: Poon Hill is known as one of the most famous tourist spots in Nepal, offering spectacular sunrise views over the Annapurna and Dhaulagiri mountain ranges. This relatively easy trek is perfect for beginners and those with limited time.
physicalFitness: Basic fitness required. Suitable for beginners.
culturalExperience: Experience Gurung and Magar culture, visit traditional villages, and learn about local customs.
itinerary: Drive from Pokhara to Nayapul and trek to Tikhedhunga
Early morning hike to Poon Hill (3,210m) for sunrise, return to Ghorepani
Trek to Nayapul and drive back to Pokhara
Departure or extend stay in Pokhara

title: Mardi Himal Trek
description: A short and spectacular trek in the Annapurna region offering close-up views of Machapuchare.
detailedDescription: Mardi Himal Trek is a short and spectacular journey in the Annapurna region, offering stunning close-up views of Machapuchare (Fishtail) and other Annapurna peaks. This relatively new trekking route provides an off-the-beaten-path experience.
physicalFitness: Good physical fitness required. Some trekking experience helpful.
culturalExperience: Experience local Gurung culture and traditional mountain lifestyle.
itinerary: Drive from Pokhara to Kande and trek to Australian Camp
Trek to Mardi Himal Base Camp (4,500m) and return to High Camp
Trek to Lumre and drive back to Pokhara

title: Lower Dolpo Trek
description: Remote trekking destination featuring the stunning Shey-Phoksundo Lake and ancient Tibetan culture.
detailedDescription: Lower Dolpo is a remote trekking destination in Nepal featuring the magnificent Shey-Phoksundo Lake at 3,612m. This trek offers an authentic experience of Tibetan culture and pristine wilderness in one of Nepal's most isolated regions.
physicalFitness: Excellent physical fitness required. Extensive trekking experience essential.
culturalExperience: Deep immersion in Tibetan Buddhist culture, ancient monasteries, and traditional Dolpo lifestyle.
itinerary: Fly Nepalgunj to Juphal and trek to Dunai
Explore Phoksundo Lake and surrounding area
Explore Shey Gompa and Crystal Mountain
Cross Jeng La Pass and trek to Tokyu
Trek to Juphal and fly to Nepalgunj, then Kathmandu

title: Pathivara Devi Pilgrimage
description: Sacred pilgrimage to Pathivara Devi Temple, believed to fulfill devotees' long-cherished dreams.
detailedDescription: Pathivara Devi Shrine at 3,794m is a popular pilgrimage destination believed to fulfill the long-cherished dreams of devotees. The temple is revered equally by Hindus and Buddhists, and offers stunning views of Kanchenjunga and Makalu ranges.
physicalFitness: Moderate fitness required. Suitable for most people.
culturalExperience: Deep spiritual experience, Hindu and Buddhist traditions, local customs and rituals.
itinerary: Trek back and drive to Kathmandu
